newsitem.title: ARGENTINA: Argentina's Gatic fails on bond payment-traders.
newsitem.headline: Argentina's Gatic fails on bond payment-traders.

text.p: Argentina's Gatic, manufacturer of Adidas sportswear, allegedly failed to make capital payments on a $40 million Eurobond that matured Monday, according to a bank director and two bond traders.
"They have not paid," said Juan Jose Aldazabal, a director at Comafi Bank. A bond trader who asked not to be named confirmed the report. Nobody was immediately available at Gatic for comment.
The Eurobond was originally issued in Jan 1994 and carries a coupon of 7.375 percent. It is denominated in dollars.
Another bond trader, employed by Comafi, also said Gatic failed to make the capital payments, but added he did not know what results this would have.
